New Records: Jayson Tatum scored a game-high 37 points and made eight of the Celtics' 29 three-pointers, setting a record for the most three-pointers in a single game by any team
Key Match Events: The Celtics led by as many as 35 points in the game, showcasing their dominance early on
Pre-Game Insights: The Celtics celebrated raising their 18th championship banner before the game, adding historical significance to the match
Post-Match Reflections: The Knicks, despite additions like Karl-Anthony Towns, struggled to keep pace with the Celtics, who were the defending champions
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game saw the Celtics making a record-tying 29 three-pointers, with the crowd chanting 'Yankees Suck!' during the match
